clinical_study.brief_title: Increasing Communication About Live Donor Kidney Transplant
clinical_study.official_title: Increasing Communication About Live Donor Kidney Transplant: A Proof of Concept

collaborator.agency: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test the efficacy of a communication intervention intended to increase and improve kidney transplant candidates' communication about live donor kidney transplantation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the number of individuals screened as potential living donors
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upon enrollment (baseline); 1 month post; 3 months post

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in intentions to discuss live donor kidney transplantation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon enrollment (baseline); 1 month post; 3 months post

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in engagement in discussion about live donor kidney transplantation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upon enrollment (baseline); 1 month post; 3 months post
secondary_outcome.description: 2 self-reported items: whether live donor kidney transplantation was discussed (yes/no) and number of discussions held

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the number of living donor kidney transplants performed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At study commencement; after all program sessions (interventions) are completed; at study conclusion

arm_group.description: Kidney transplant candidates randomized to this arm will receive only the education provided by the transplant center. After data collection activities have concluded, transplant candidates in this arm will be offered the opportunity to attend a program session.
Participants randomized to Living Donor Transplant Education 1 will receive education on living donor kidney transplantation and its discussion.

Participants randomized to Living Donor Transplant Education 2 will receive education on living donor kidney transplantation and its discussion; they will also have the opportunity to practice discussing living kidney transplantation with simulated patients portraying participants' conversational partners.

intervention.description: The Living Donor Transplant Education informs kidney transplant candidates about living donor transplants and provides guidance in broaching and maintaining discussion about the topic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Wait listed for kidney transplantation in active status (i.e., status 1 or 2)
- Adult (at least 18 years of age)
- English speaking
- Capable of making medical decisions (i.e., not cognitively impaired)
- Non-institutionalized
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not listed for kidney transplantation or wait listed, but not in active status
- Under 18 years of age
- Non-English speaking
- Cognitively impaired
- Institutionalized
